meanings.definition: A range of frequencies or wavelengths that are allowed to pass through a filter or system.
meanings.sent1: The bandpasses of the radio receiver determine which signals can come through.
meanings.sent2: The scientist adjusted the bandpasses on the spectrometer to focus on specific light wavelengths.
meanings.sent3: The bandpasses of the security system were so strict, even the slightest noise triggered an alarm.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like bandpasses, filtering out unnecessary information to focus on what truly mattered.
meanings.sent5: The bandpasses of the telescope revealed a stunning array of stars in the night sky.

meanings.definition: To allow certain frequencies or wavelengths to pass through a filter or system.
meanings.sent1: The technician bandpasses the audio signals before they reach the amplifier.
meanings.sent2: She carefully bandpasses the light through the lens to create a sharp image.
meanings.sent3: The magician bandpasses the cards, ensuring only the chosen one remains in his hand.
meanings.sent4: His words bandpasses through the crowd, reaching only those who were truly listening.
meanings.sent5: The river bandpasses through the valley, carrying life-giving water to the fields below.
